intro: Geissanthus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the cool, moist conditions of its habitat. Geissanthus peruvianus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
